title: New Leda and the Swan
credit_line: Purchase: gift of the Hunt Foundation
provenance_text:
Robert Broderson [1920-1992], Durham, NC; Catherine Viviano Gallery, Inc., New York, NY, until February 1965 [1]; purchased by Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, May 1965 [2].

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 283 in "The 1964 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1964 - January 1965. It was lent by Catherine Viviano Gallery, New York, NY.
[2]. The painting was purchased by Carnegie Institute from the 1964 International as a gift of the Hunt Foundation, Pittsburgh, PA. Payment to Catherine Viviano Gallery was sent on February 1, 1965 and receipt acknowledged on February 18, 1965. The painting was accessioned later in the year, on May 11, 1965.
